workDescription: Fix PDF export formatting issues with tables and images. Tables break across pages poorly, images get distorted. Users complain exports look unprofessional.

context.userProblem: Exported PDFs look broken. Tables split mid-row, images stretched or pixelated. Users embarrassed to send to clients.
context.businessValue: Reduce support tickets (25% are about PDF exports). Improve user satisfaction. Prevent churn.
context.currentState: Using standard PDF library with default settings. No custom pagination logic.

noGos: Don't rebuild the entire export system
Don't touch other export features (CSV, JSON)

successCriteria: Tables don't break mid-row across pages

constraints: Can't change underlying PDF library (too risky)
Must work with existing document structure

notes: This is a SMALL BATCH example (2 weeks, smaller team)
Demonstrates fixing quality issues within tight appetite
Shows how to scope bug fixes using Shape Up principles
Good example of clear boundaries for technical work
Note: no cool-down for small batch (optional)
